question:
You recently did a short cookery course. The cookery school has asked for your feedback on this course. 

Write a letter to the course director at the cookery school. In your letter

- describe what you enjoyed about the course
- say how much cooking you've done since the course
- suggest another cookery course you'd like the school to offer
text: I am writing to offer some valuable feedback on the cookery course that I did last month at your renowned school.

I would like to start by thanking you and your team for tutoring students with so much patience. Because the course was so thorough, I never faced any difficulty in comprehending the details. After learning to cook a wide variety of cuisines from such a well-known institute , I believe I will have an array of opportunities in the future.

Since the completion of my course, I have been cooking every day. I am glad to inform you that I got an internship at a cafe on  Rogers Street. They were happy to offer me a stipend as well because of the generous feedback I got from one of your master chefs.

Although the course was undoubtedly perfect, it mostly focussed on teaching the preparation of main-course meals. It would be great if you could add a complimentary starter and a sweet dish-making course to the original one.
I hope my insights will be valuable.
